greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of q^(-2/3) * (eta(q) * eta(q^3) * eta(q^6) / eta(q^2))^2 in powers of q.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of f(-x^3)^6 / f(x, x^2)^2 = phi(-x^3)^2 * f(-x, -x^5)^2 in powers of x where phi(), f() are Ramanujan theta functions. - _Michael Somos_, Mar 22 2015
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (36 t)) = 16 (t/i)^2 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A252651. - _Michael Somos_, Mar 22 2015
mathematica: QP:= QPochhammer; a[n_]:= SeriesCoefficient[QP[x^3]^6/(QP[-x, x^3]* QP[-x^2, x^3]*QP[x^3])^2, {x, 0, n}]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 15 2018 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( (eta(x + A) * eta(x^3 + A) * eta(x^6 + A) / eta(x^2 + A))^2, n))};
(MAGMA) A := Basis( ModularForms( Gamma0(36), 2), 180); A[3] - 2*A[6] + A[9]; /* _Michael Somos_, Mar 22 2015 */
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Apr 21 2006
